SqlErrorCollection.summary: Collects all errors generated by the .NET Framework Data Provider for SQL Server. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is created by <xref:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlException> to collect instances of the <xref:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlError> class. <xref:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlErrorCollection> always contains at least one instance of the <xref:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlError> class.
## Examples The following example displays each <xref:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlError> within the <xref:Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.SqlErrorCollection> collection.
[!code-csharp[SqlError_ToString Example#1](~/../sqlclient/doc/samples/SqlError_ToString.cs#1)]

CopyTo.summary: Copies the elements of the collection.

CopyToArrayIndex1.param: The index from which to start copying into the parameter.
CopyToArrayIndex1.summary: Copies the elements of the collection into an , starting at the specified index.
CopyToArrayIndex1.exception: The sum of and the number of elements in the collection is greater than the of the .

CopyToArrayIndex2.param: The to copy the elements into.
The index from which to start copying into the parameter.
CopyToArrayIndex2.summary: Copies the elements of the collection into a , starting at the specified index.
CopyToArrayIndex2.exception: The sum of and the number of elements in the collection is greater than the length of the .

Count.summary: Gets the number of errors in the collection.
Count.value: The total number of errors in the collection.

remarks.format:

GetEnumerator.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Enumerators can be used to read the data in a collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.

Item.param: The zero-based index of the error to retrieve.
Item.summary: Gets the error at the specified index.
Item.value: A that contains the error at the specified index.

Item.exception: Index parameter is outside array bounds.
